website_summaries.verdict: Small in stature but throws down like a champ, this sandbag is appealing in size and price point.
pros: Works especially well for team sports where athletes require cost effective cross training
Stands up to high impact workouts as well as feedback in terms of results
Design helps improve grip, wrists, and forearms
cons: Consider other sand options in lieu of the pre-filled ones

customer_reviews.title: If you can afford them buy the prefilled ones
customer_reviews.text: Buy the prefilled ones. I have purchased 10 of these: 2x15lb, 2x12lb, 2x10lb, 2x8lb and 2x4lb all empty. I purchased them over a few months. I’ve previously purchased other sandbag workout items so I’m very familiar and have the process/equipment required. It’s the neck of the tube and angle that you will struggle with. If you’re on a budget I totally get it BUT if you can afford the prefilled ones then buy them - it’s not worth the frustration.
customer_reviews.author: trBlsmebstrd

customer_reviews.title: If I had the money I'd go for a steel bell but I love my sandbell!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! Yeah it's kind of time consuming to fill but I'll trade it for how much shipping would be if it came profiled. I probably use this 3-4 times a week in my workouts. You can slam it, toss it, kick it, whatever. It's made very well. I've completely abused this thing & have only noticed a few grains of sand sneak out, it'll probably be years before I have to add any. It's soft enough it not damage any floors, gym equipment, body parts, yet durable enough to take a brutal workout time & time again.
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: Not a slam ball replacement but a whole new version of the same.  Great addition.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. Stuff with a plastic trash bag and you can fill it with wet sand, or sand then water and get more weight out of it. Excellent home gym product, especially during COVID
customer_reviews.author: Bryguy

customer_reviews.title: 25lb sandbell
customer_reviews.text: Mine was listed as "used", but it did not appear to be used at all (no scuffs, tears or loose stitching). After picking up some playground sand from my local home improvement store, I filled up my 25lb bell. It is holding just fine. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Eee-Bee

customer_reviews.title: Had mine for years
customer_reviews.text: Easy to fill. Perfect for exercise. I've had this for years now and no holes or tears. Very durable. We filled with play sand from Lowes.
customer_reviews.author: Shay

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding this sandbag was purchased to replace my last Hyperwear ...
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding this sandbag was purchased to replace my last Hyperwear Sand Bell Neoprene Sandbag. I definitely have absolutely have no complaints. This bag is durable and very heavy once the sand is added. Bonus to my work out.
customer_reviews.author: Queenron

customer_reviews.title: Durable but some sand leaks out
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the sand bells in my group circuit training class and like them so much I bought them for personal use and training with friends. I purchased washed playground sand as recommended, but it wasn't dry enough, so filling the sand bells was brutally frustrating and time consuming. I would recommend making sure the sand is very dry before filling the sand bell. I've been using them now for about a month. The sand bell is durable, but a small amount of sand has leaked out during use. I use them outdoors so it's been ok, but I wouldn't recommend using them indoors.
customer_reviews.author: Bean

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: This was a great addition to my work out routine. Very good quality product, and easy to set up. I picked up some play sand at a home depot along with a funnel, which you need to fill it. It comes with a rubber band to close off the tube. Stuck it pack inside the sandbell and it was ready to go. I use it several times a week and so far no sand has leaked out. Very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Corey E. Lepiarz

customer_reviews.title: Good workout tool, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: met all my expectations and enjoy using them during my work-out....much easier to handle than dumbbells. I found them easy to fill after I left the sand in the sun to completely dry, but with a slight amount of moisture in the sand, a no-go situation.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Kiesey

customer_reviews.title: Easy to fill- use a long funnel
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought the 25 and 6 pound bags unfilled. I spent under 5 on a bag of sand and a long funnel. The bags were easy to fill and haven't leaked. I have a broken wrist and sandbells are less strenuous on my wrist because how the sand distributes vs a kettlebell.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle O.

customer_reviews.title: It's nice but didn't come with the Rubberband as stated
customer_reviews.text: It's nice but didn't come with the Rubberband as stated. I have a sandbag full of sand now that I cant seal.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Gift item
customer_reviews.text: A gift item. Unsure if she has filled it yet, but it was exactly what she asked for on her gift registry.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Marie

customer_reviews.title: It isn't pre-filled!!
customer_reviews.text: Love the product. The only issue is that it is not filled with sand. I had to buy sand then fill the bag. When i ordered it, I did not realize it was not filled. It's great for hand strength and grip. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jerone

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I just got around to opening these up. The vendor does not mention, at least not where I could read, that the sandbells come unprepared with no sand. I have to go buy the sand, a funnel, find a rubber band--which was supposed to be included but wasn't--and figure out how to set them up. The instructions are unclear. Guess I'll have to go on YouTube and find a DYI video. In short, I am not happy with the way the product was delivered. Sorry....
customer_reviews.author: HugoElle_1981

customer_reviews.title: Find the sand, happy training days
customer_reviews.text: Happy training days after I finally got the sand to fill the sandbag. Terrific for training and very versatile. You are responsible for the sand and the actual product is fantastic
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful equipment.
customer_reviews.text: 100% great exercise tool. I love the softness of them. and for variety. You can fill easy.. and thy don't hurt your wrists or your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl R.G. Samms

customer_reviews.title: Dusty
customer_reviews.text: Sand comes out of the seems when slammed. No a lot but its annoying.
customer_reviews.author: W.Brown

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I really great product you won't be disappointed.I've used everything from kettlebells to band to work equipment
customer_reviews.author: anthony norman

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the first one I got so much, I bought a second one. They both show no signs of wear after two months of solid use. I've opened up the feed tube several times to adjust the weight and it still feels secure. I am 100% on this product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome quality product
customer_reviews.text: The material is very sturdy. I have only had this for about a month but I can tell it is going to hold up to all the abuse I'm going to put it through. It was easy to fill with regular kid's play sand.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Coperich

customer_reviews.title: No sand... So it's a $90 bag?!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe this product is so expensive. I own plenty of gym equipment but I just can't rationalize how this product comes with no sand or a funnel or ties for this product / these simple materials
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have purchased. I love its durability. It adds a fun twist to my bootcamps. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lori L. Yates

customer_reviews.title: Safer than Dumbbells
customer_reviews.text: I use this product in my strength training class. Use for any exercise that requires weight when a dumbbell is too awkward or unsafe
customer_reviews.author: J. Warren

customer_reviews.title: great product. better than I actually expected
customer_reviews.text: great product. better than I actually expected. has become a regular part of my workout program.
customer_reviews.author: bill duffy

customer_reviews.title: Great Sandbell!
customer_reviews.text: Love being able to use this for my kettlebell swings, wall balls, floor slams....very versatile and easy to hang on to!
customer_reviews.author: dski

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Hey I filled mine with clear beans for stuffed animals and use it for a head pillow on the reformer! Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Freytag

customer_reviews.title: A must buy
customer_reviews.text: OMG!! It works.....I'm saving to get the remains sandbells and dvd....I wish the sand was affordable on amazon but I had to go to home Depot it was only $4.55 for a 50lbs bag :)
customer_reviews.author: LaTrisha  Woods

customer_reviews.title: need a better disclosure please
customer_reviews.text: Not 25lb. These are 6 lb. need a better disclosure please. Womp Womp
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to fill
customer_reviews.text: had to buy 2 different funnels, if you made the mistake of buying this gimmick make sure you have a funnel long enough to get through the nozzle into the bag, so after making 2 trips to get everything I needed. It took over an hour to stuff the dry playground sand a tablespoon at a time into the 15-pound gimmick. over priced time waster for 35 dollars, it should come filled. won't be purchasing again
customer_reviews.author: JimmyJ

customer_reviews.title: a great work out
customer_reviews.text: The sandbell is a great tool for working out. I have been using it for a few weeks, 3-4 times per week; with multiple slams and throwing techniques it is not showing any signs of wear. You will need to have a funnel to fill (got mine at home depot) and it takes a little time to fill, but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Kunze

customer_reviews.title: Love using these with clients & in my own workouts
customer_reviews.text: As a 25 year veteran of the fitness industry. I am constantly looking at ways to challenge my clients in a functional way versus the "standard American workout". The instability and give on a sandbell adds that challenge to the nervousness system.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Smith

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Made very well. No need to worry about leaks when slamming them. I found them easy to fill and use.
customer_reviews.author: Carter

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, easy to fill
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product for varying your workouts. Bought it empty and filled it with 'dry play sand.' Very simple and inexpensive. I primarily use it for hill running, 400m repeats and various exercises (swings, throws, etc,) Excellent training tool.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: easy to fill as long as you have a funnel ...
customer_reviews.text: Durable, easy to fill as long as you have a funnel (I bought the one recommended by amazon for 1$). Great for spartan training or at home workouts. I bought several different sizes.
customer_reviews.author: sophie

customer_reviews.title: Even if you already have a set of dumbbells, once you use these, you'll want a set of these
customer_reviews.text: I love my sandbells. I find so many uses for them. Anything you can do with a dumbbell or kettle bell, plus things like grip exercises, where i toss the sandbell and grab it. Because you can hold the sandbell with any grip you want, and change grips easily, this is extremely friendly on the joints.
customer_reviews.author: Mark52

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My personal trainer loves it for all of his clients I purchased it for his birthday
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Walker

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: This is one the best workout tools in my 15 years of fitness experience. it could be a little cheaper but what are you going to do!
customer_reviews.author: Carey Clark

customer_reviews.title: Hyperwear sandbell
customer_reviews.text: I just love this product. It is so versitile and can do so many things. My clients like it as well. So much better than a kettlebell and safe and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Good product, needs a little better stitching but good deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Harris Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: It seems like I am always checking the elastic to make sure ...
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting a more durable product. It seems like I am always checking the elastic to make sure the sand will not come pouring out when I have my clients use it. A good idea but not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Pumpedup

customer_reviews.title: Careful ordering filled vs unfilled
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a filled bell and got an unfilled one. Pretty careful selecting as I didn't want to mess with filling this up. When ordering the filled/unfilled was conveniently cut off on order summary and even when selecting the item to check...again. My advice just buy unfilled. Sandbells are wonderful, very hard for little ones to hurt themselves with, my girls think it is funny to drop on their feet. They also work to hold down things that shouldn't tip. Ours do double duty as Christmas Tree anti tip device.
customer_reviews.author: Mom and Auntie Angel

customer_reviews.title: Leaks sand
customer_reviews.text: Had high hopes for these sand bells. Followed the directions perfectly on all three I bought. If you use them at all, they get sand everywhere. . It seems impossible that sand would come out of that top opening but it gets in your mouth. I have clients that I now have to 'teach' how not to eat sand . When I use them, I'm not super picky, but with my clients, it's kind of annoying. I might sew them and see if it helps.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: portable 'dumbell'
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my training. It is very useful as i can bring it around easily. This sandbell can be use indoor or outdoor. I used it a lot of balancing exercise. But after just a couple of usage my sandbell start to leak. I'm not sure what cause the leak till i found a cut at the back of sandbell which i'm not sure how the cut get there. So I think even though this sandbell is portable and good for training but may not as 'tough' as it should be as per description.
customer_reviews.author: christine

customer_reviews.title: Great For Kids Too!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sandbells I bought for my kids to use. This completes my collection of 10lbs - 50lbs steelbells I bought from Onnit.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Dan

customer_reviews.title: GREAT WORKOUT BUT VERY HARD TO FILL SAND IN
customer_reviews.text: I love this sand bell. It is great for working out with. Ive used it many times at a cross-fit gym. HOWEVER....IT IS A PAIN IN THE A** TO PUT SAND IN IT. I MEAN ITS REALLY REALLY REALLY HARD. I USED 3 DIFFERENT FUNNELS AND IT TOOK OVER 1.5 HOUR. PLEASE CONSIDER THIS. HYPERWEAR- PLEASE CONSIDER SUPPLYING US WITH THE RIGHT SIZE FUNNEL. WE PAY SO MUCH FOR THIS PRODUCT AT LEAST YOU CAN DO IS GIVE US THE RIGHT FUNNEL. VERY VERY VERY VERY HARD TO PUT SAND IN. GREAT PRODUCT ONCE ITS IN THOUGH!
customer_reviews.author: Kabir

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this product for personal training clients and P.E. Students.
customer_reviews.author: Chloe

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy this unless you have cheap access to playground sand and a funnel!
customer_reviews.text: It does not come filled with sand and that was not clear. I have been unable to find the sand to fill it at a reasonable cost so the product has been essentially useless
customer_reviews.author: David Bergman

customer_reviews.title: was sad to see that
customer_reviews.text: Does not come with sand!!! was sad to see that
customer_reviews.author: daekee min

product_meta.title: Hyperwear SandBell Neoprene SandBag Free Weight Unfilled 2-50 lbs
product_meta.description: The Hyperwear SandBell free weight combines strengths from some of the most popular pieces of fitness equipment. Use the Hyperwear SandBell in place of a medicine ball, slam ball, dumbbell or kettle bell and prepare to work muscles you didn’t even know existed. The active, shifting movement of the sand challenges stabilizing muscles in your core. When working out with the Hyperwear SandBell, you will engage hand- and wrist-gripping muscles that are typically not activated and strengthened. The dynamic SandBell weight fires more muscle burning more calories giving you more results in less time. Another advantage of this product lies in its safety for you and your floors. On a slick floor you can use the SandBell for a variety of ab coaster and glide or sliding core exercises. The outer sand disc shape, made of durable, stretchy neoprene, contains a leak-proof core that can be easily emptied and filled with dry play sand. Dry washed all purpose sand is recommended, which can be obtained at home improvement stores.. US Patent 8,622,877 B2. SandBell is a registered trademark.
feature_bullets: Unique patented design works grip, wrist and forearms
Shifting sand provides active resistance for stabilizing core muscles
Alternative to medicine balls, kettle bells, dumbbells, etc.
Safer and easier on people and floors than metal weights
Sold unfilled; simply fill with dry all-purpose sand
